 Campaign Coordinator with a focus on sport & gaming - Part time
   

  

 Are you always up to date with the latest trends, scrolling TikTok and Instagram for inspiration? Do you have a sharp eye for sport and gaming influencers and a creative mindset for making campaigns unforgettable?
   

  

 If you’re feeling excited seeing this and thinking,
 **“This is totally me!”** 
 – keep reading!
   

  

 Cure Media is the leading influencer marketing agency in the Nordics – awarded
 *Influencer Marketing Agency of the Year* 
 and ranked as a top global tech platform. We deliver exceptional results for brands like L'Oréal, Kappahl and Lyko and our growth is just getting started. If you’re passionate about the influencer world and ready to help brands create impact, this might be your perfect fit!
   

  

*We’re now looking for a passionate and driven Campaign Coordinator in the beginning of your career, to join us on our journey to becoming the first choice for brands and influencers in Europe!*
**About The Role**
 As a Campaign Coordinator, you’ll collaborate closely with our Campaign Directors to bring ideas to life, from concept to completion. You’ll coordinate with influencers, ensure every project aligns with client goals and creative briefs, and contribute to campaigns that exceed expectations. With your organizational skills and proactive communication, you’ll help every campaign run smoothly and successfully from start to finish.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A front-row seat to one of the world’s fastest-growing and most dynamic marketing methods.
* An impactful role in a close-knit, high-performing team with a culture that values fun and teamwork just as much as success!
* Exciting projects with top-tier brands like L’Oréal, Intersport and Skånemejerier, leveraging our leading-edge tech for influencer marketing.
* Global connections – work with influencers from all corners of the world and create campaigns that reach millions!
* The opportunity to work with exciting industries like sports, beauty, fashion, and food, creating campaigns that resonate and inspire.


**Your Responsibilities**
* Assist Campaign Directors with reports, and feedback to maintain alignment with client goals, campaign objectives and briefs.
* Identify, engage, and manage influencers, keeping them informed on campaign goals, timelines, and deliverables.
* Ensure campaigns meet internal deadlines and proactively addressing any challenges.
* Gather insights from clients, implementing feedback to continuously improve campaign results.
* Build strong teamwork with Campaign Directors and the coordinator team, contributing to a smooth and efficient workflow.


**Are you the one we’re looking for?**
* It is mandatory that you’re either a student or have another primary occupation but can commit around two days a week.
* You’re an influencer marketing enthusiast, active on platforms like Instagram, YouTube, or TikTok.
* Highly organized, you thrive on efficiency and structure.
* You’re driven by results, working hard to achieve goals and ensure client and influencer satisfaction.
* Fluent in both Swedish and English, you’re a strong communicator.
* Experience in influencer marketing with a brand or agency? Even better.


**Start:** 
 ASAP
 **Location:** 
 Stockholm
 **Hours:** 
 Part time, around 2 days a week
   

  

 If you have any questions about the role, career development opportunities, or anything else? Get in touch!
   

  

 Department Operations & Client Success Role Campaign Coordinator Locations Stockholm Remote status Hybrid
   

  

 Contact Beatrice Lidström Schönmeier Coordinator Lead – Operations & Client Success

 More jobs
   

  

 Stockholm
   

  

 What about perks and benefits?
   

  

* Shared success


 We want everyone to have a share in our future success. Therefore we offer our employees a generous stock option plan, aligning everyone towards our shared goals and future achievements.
   

  

* Great development opportunities


 Since we are a fast-growing company in a fast-moving industry, our employees have great opportunities to evolve, both on a personal level as well as on their career path. Everyone is encouraged to nurture their individual talents and develop within areas they are passionate about.
   

  

* Fun at work


 We believe in celebrating our achievements and building strong team bonds. That’s why we organize bi-annual conference trips to exciting locations like Marbella, Barcelona, and London! Additionally, we have regular after-work events where we can unwind and enjoy each other's company.
   

  

* Reward and recognition


 We celebrate our successes and believe in rewarding hard work. We offer extra vacation days, competitive health packages, and generous pension plans to ensure our team stays healthy and happy.
   

  

 How's life at Cure Media?
   

  

 Our values—result-focused, brave, and passionate—are at the core of everything we do. Working at Cure Media is an exciting, evolving, and challenging experience. We strive to be the best in influencer marketing, and that requires dedication and a commitment to excellence.
   

  

 We pride ourselves not only on our industry-leading work but also on our vibrant company culture. From our renowned happy hour events to our supportive and energetic workplace, we cultivate a “can-do” attitude, serve great coffee, and prioritize being there for each other and our customers.
   

  

**About Cure Media**
 Cure Media is a leading independent Influencer Marketing company with global reach, focusing on the fashion, home, beauty and FMCG. We build successful influencer strategies for marketing teams and run campaigns with influencers on social platforms such as Instagram, TikTok and YouTube. Some of our clients are L'Oréal, Sephora, Kappahl and Wolt.
   

  

 Cure Media was awarded as the “Agency of the Year 2022” at the Influencer Marketing Summit. We've also been awarded “Best Large Influencer Marketing Agency” and “Best Influencer Marketing Platform” two years in a row at Global Influencer Marketing Awards. Additionally, we are certified by IAB as a Qualified Influencer Marketing Partner.
   

  

 Founded in 2014

title: Model Validation Lead
job_function: General Business, Management, and Business Development
description:
**What will you be doing?**
 As Model Validation Lead, you will be part of the second line function and report to the Head of Model Validation. The team is responsible for the independent validation of risk and valuation models, as well as for developing and continuously improving the Model Risk Management Framework.
   

  

 You will play a key role in ensuring that Nasdaq Clearing’s models are robust, reliable, and compliant. This includes reviewing model design, implementation, and documentation, as well as replicating and benchmarking models. You’ll work closely with model owners, external validators, and senior stakeholders—translating complex quantitative insights into clear, strategic recommendations.
   

  

 You’ll work across all models used within Nasdaq Clearing—not just one and You’re encouraged to question, critique, and improve models. This is a non-operational, independent role with deep analytical tasks and our work directly supports financial stability and risk management in the derivatives clearing space.
   

  

**Requirements** 
 :
   

  

* A strong academic background in mathematics, physics, engineering, finance or similar
* 5-10 years of experience within quantitative financial risk management, ideally from derivatives in various asset classes
* Experience from banks, credit institutions, or other financial firms and have familiarity with credit risk, market risk, capital and liquidity models
* Hands-on experience with Python or similar tools
* Deep understanding of model validation techniques such as backtesting, sensitivity testing, and stress testing
* A critical, analytical mindset
* Excellent communication skills and the humility to challenge others constructively
* A self-driven with the integrity to stand by your assessments


**What Do We Offer You**
* Interesting work with friendly colleagues from the Baltics and Nordics, who are willing to share their extensive experience
* Unlimited access to e-learning platforms, offering continuous and extensive learning opportunities
* Internal Mentorship program - learn from an employee you look up to
* Nasdaq's Flex Day program (additional 6 paid leave days a year)
* Annual monetary bonus and other benefits such as sports club membership compensation
* Comfortable and modern working environment


**Does this sound like you?**
 We value our talented employees, and whenever possible strive to help one of our associates grow professionally before recruiting new talent to our open positions. If you think the open position, you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!
   

  

 This is a full-time permanent position located in Stockholm. Nasdaq offers you a hybrid workplace to find a balance between working from home and collaborating in the office, therefore it's required to come into the office at least 3 days per week.
   

  

**Come as You Are**
**Nasdaq is an equal opportunity employer. We positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of age, color, disability, national origin, ancestry, race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable law.**
**We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.**

title: Erfarna Penetrationstestare
description:
**Nu söker vi flera erfarna penetrationstestare till vår SOC-team!** 




 Har du erfarenhet av att jobba med Sliver, Cobalt Strike eller Bloodhound? Vet du vad DNS exfiltrering, EDR bypassing och memory injection innebär? Då kan det vara just dig vi söker! Läs vidare för att se om tjänsten som penetrationstestare på Sveriges riksbank kan vara något för dig!
 



  





**OM OSS** 




 Riksbanken är navet i Sveriges finansiella system och våra IT-system är grunden för vår finansiella stabilitet och utveckling. Vår IT-miljö är omfattande och består av flera samhällskritiska system som ställer mycket höga krav på säkerhet. Vi är både en myndighet och ”bankernas bank” vilket ställer höga krav på stabilitet, långsiktighet och att vi ligger i framkant inom IT- och cybersäkerhetsfrågor.
 



  





**DIN ROLL** 




 Vi som arbetar med att skydda Riksbankens IT-system nöjer oss inte med att vara ”bara” bra, utan vi strävar alltid efter att vara bäst. För att vi ska nå denna målbild krävs att vi hela tiden strävar efter att förbättra våra förmågor och vår kompetens. Vi söker därför dig som vill bidra till att stärka och utveckla vår IT- och cybersäkerhet. Som Penetrationstestare hos oss får du en unik chans att arbeta med kritiska system och att sätta din prägel på säkerhetsarbetet.
 



  





 Som penetrationstestare på Sveriges riksbank arbetar du tillsammans med IT och verksamheten för att förstå och identifiera vad som behöver testas. Penetrationstester utförs i samarbete med SOC-analytiker som säkerställer att nödvändig upptäcksförmåga finns på plats.
 



  





 Som Penetrationstestare hos oss kommer du att spela en avgörande roll i att skydda våra IT-system och infrastruktur. Det innebär bl.a att:
 



  




* Planera och genomföra Red/Purple Team-tester
* Genomföra penetrationstester av vår IT-miljö, inklusive samhällskritiska system, infrastruktur, molntjänster och klienter
* Koordinera och stödja externa penetrationstester
* Delta i cybersäkerhetstävlingar (till exempel CTF)



  





 Du ges dessutom möjlighet att:
 


* Delta i internationella forum inom IT-säkerhetsområdet
* Stödja Riksbankens systemutveckling med dess DevSecOps arbete
* Bidra till intern kompetenshöjning genom utbildningar eller interna labbar där medarbetare får testa på ”hacking”



  





**DITT TEAM** 




 Riksbankens IT-verksamhet leds av en IT-chef och består av sex enheter som leds av varsin enhetschef. Du tillhör Enheten för Säkerhet & Arkitektur där du kommer arbeta nära och i samarbete med andra Penetrationstestare, SOC-ansvarig, IT-säkerhetsansvariga, IT-säkerhetsarkitekter, systemansvariga, IT-arkitekter, verksamheten, och Riksbankens leverantörer.
 



  





**MER OM DIG** 




 Vi söker dig som har en universitets- eller högskoleutbildning inom datateknik, datavetenskap eller systemvetenskap. Alternativt har du erhållit kunskaper genom arbetslivserfarenhet som vi bedömer som motsvariga. Du har en stark teknisk förståelse, uppskattar att fördjupa dig i tekniska detaljer och vill ständigt lära dig nya saker inom området. Du är självgående, strukturerad, målinriktad och har en god analytisk förmåga.
 



  





 Krav:
 


* Flera års erfarenhet av att genomföra avancerade penetrationstester
* God kunskap av svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.



  





 Meriterande:
 


* Erfarenhet av systemutveckling och programmering
* Relevant certifiering inom området. Exempelvis certifieringar från Offensive Security, SANS eller certifieringarna CRTO, CRTO II
* Erfarenhet från Capture the Flag övningar
* Djup teknisk kunskap från Windows- och Linuxmiljöer



  





**MER OM TJÄNSTEN** 



* Tillträde: Enligt överenskommelse
* Anställningstyp: Tillsvidareanställning
* Placering: Huvudkontoret på Brunkebergstorg samt HK Klara Klarabergsgatan, mitt i centrala Stockholm
* Arbetstid: Förtroendearbetstid
* Möjlighet att jobba distans: Upp till 2 dagar i veckan
* Förmåner: Generösa semestervillkor, löneväxling till pension, subventionerad lunch i personalmatsal, friskvårdsbidrag, subventionerad massage och tillgång till gym och ledarledda träningspass samt tillgång till ett låst cykelrum i byggnaden.



  





 Tjänsten kan komma att placeras i säkerhetsklass och en säkerhetsprövning innefattande registerkontroll, säkerhetsprövningssamtal och särskild personutredning görs då för slutkandidaten. För vissa tjänster ställs krav på svenskt medborgarskap.
 



  





**ATT JOBBA PÅ RIKSBANKEN** 




 Riksbanken är en myndighet under riksdagen som ser till att pengarna behåller sitt värde över tid och att betalningar kan ske säkert och effektivt. Vi ger också ut Sveriges sedlar och mynt. Vi arbetar på medborgarnas uppdrag för en stark och säker ekonomi. Här får du utmaningar utvecklas varje dag i en händelserik miljö. Hos oss får du kunniga och engagerade kollegor och stor möjlighet till kompetensutveckling. Läs mer om hur det är att arbeta på Riksbanken
 **här** 




  





**VÄLKOMMEN MED DIN ANSÖKAN!** 




 Välkommen med din ansökan snarast,
 **dock senast 11 aug.** 




 Vi vill att du i denna rekrytering besvarar ett antal urvalsfrågor. Vi genomför bakgrundskontroller på slutkandidaterna, vilket innebär att du lämnar in examensbevis eller annat dokument som styrker din utbildning och vi kontrollerar att dessa stämmer.
 



  





 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Riksbanken med IDG Recruitment. Vid frågor är du varmt välkommen att kontakta rekryteringskonsult Oscar Nordström. Du kan läsa mer om hur det fungerar när du söker jobb på Riksbanken här. Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!

title: Modersmålslärare i tyska
description:
**Du fokuserar på framtiden. Och är närvarande i nuet.
 *Precis som vi.***
***"Vad vill du bli när du blir stor? Vi gör det möjligt."***
**Här på Sundbybergs Globala** 
 arbetar vi medvetet med att utveckla elevernas kunskaper och förmågor genom att göra vårt yttersta att hjälpa dem i deras skolgång. Vi arbetar professionellt med eleven i fokus utifrån den svenska skolans demokratiska värdegrund. Vi har stort engagemang och en härlig stämning på Sundbybergs Globala. Vi erbjuder dig en dynamisk och utvecklande arbetsmiljö tillsammans med våra andra skickliga lärare. Hos oss kan du göra skillnad.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 
 innebär att du är en länk mellan eleven, hemmet, skolan och Sundbybergs Globala. Du använder ditt modersmål och din kompetens för att stödja eleven att nå bästa möjliga resultat. Du kommer också att delta i arbetet med mottagandet av nyanlända elever.
   

  

**Vi vill att du** 
 har
 **tyska** 
 som modersmål och behärskar svenska i tal och skrift. Vi vill också att du har högskoleutbildning, gärna som lärare och kunskaper om och erfarenhet av tvåspråkig undervisning. Du är ansvarstagande, har helhetssyn och ett professionellt bemötande. Med engagemang och förmåga att arbeta självständigt, och i grupp, hittar du lösningar för att kunna erbjuda undervisning för alla dina elever under rådande förutsättningar. Vi använder digitalt verktyg i vårt arbete och vi ser gärna att du är nyfiken och van IT-användare. Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet och samarbetsförmåga. Lärarlegitimation är önskvärt och meriterande.
   

  

 Tjänsten är på deltid (15%), till och med den 19 december 2025. Tillträde 1 september 2025. Intervjuer sker löpande. Ansök senast den 8 september 2025. Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via e-post eller brev.
   

  

 Vid anställning kommer utdrag ur belastningsregistret att behöva uppvisas. Se mer information på: https://polisen.se/tjanster-tillstand/belastningsregistret/
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**
**Övrig information**
 En stor del av vår verksamhet klassas som samhällsviktig verksamhet.
   

  

 Tjänsten kan komma att krigsplaceras inom ramen för Sundbybergs stads roll i totalförsvaret.
   

  

 Vi tackar nej till dig som säljer annonser och rekryteringstjänster.

title: Senior Enterprise Architect - Tietoevry Care (m/f/d)
description:
**Job Description**
**At Tietoevry Care you’ll get a chance to provide patients and end users with product offerings that help them in their life, reinventing the world for good. If that sounds interesting, please keep on reading.**
**About Us**
 Tietoevry Care is modernizing the Nordic health and social care sector with modular, open, and interoperable software. We develop and deliver high quality software solutions and services that enable healthcare and welfare professionals to do their work even better and with higher efficiency - have more time to care.
   

  

 We are a global team of professionals working on providing products and services to different sectors from healthcare to social care. In addition to working closely with our customers, we also have our own products that we build and develop for various fields in society. From enabling healthcare professionals to spend more valuable time with their patients to providing data for professional athletes to achieve even better results, we make all that possible. With us you can build technology for the good of society and make your mark on the health and wellbeing of people in need.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are looking for a strategic and visionary Enterprise Architect who can define, lead, and align our technology strategy across the entire healthcare platform ecosystem. In this role, you will
   

  

* Set the architectural direction for our platform products
* Oversee alignment across different products
* Ensure long-term scalability, interoperability, and maintainability
* Support international expansion into the wider European healthcare market


**You will engage directly with**
* Customers to explore new clinical and operational workflows, and digital transformation needs
* Partners to co-develop, integrate, and ensure compatibility within a modular platform ecosystem
* Product Management and Product Owners to align architectural vision with product strategies and roadmaps


**As an Enterprise Architect, you will**
* Define and evolve the enterprise-wide architecture for our healthcare platform products
* Align architecture across product teams, domains, and business stakeholders
* Drive adherence to healthcare standards such as openEHR, FHIR, and HL7
* Lead strategic architectural initiatives such as modularization, capability-based planning, and platform evolution
* Govern architecture principles and ensure compliance across all layers (business, application, data, and infrastructure)
* Act as a key advisor to business and product leadership regarding technology roadmaps and transformation programs
* Guide solution and software architects and foster collaboration across multidisciplinary teams
* Contribute to technology partner strategies, vendor evaluations, and interoperability initiatives


**We Are Looking For Someone With**
* Broad experience in enterprise architecture across complex product ecosystems
* Deep understanding of architecture principles / frameworks
* Proven ability to align business and technology strategies
* Familiarity with open digital health platforms and healthcare-specific standards (openEHR, FHIR)
* Experience designing scalable and modular architecture in cloud-native and containerized environments
* Leadership experience in driving change and enterprise-wide architecture governance
* Strong communication and stakeholder management skills, including international and partner collaboration


**As a Person You Are**
* Strategic in your thinking and system-minded
* Collaborative and able to work across different teams, organizations and cultures
* Committed to excellence and long-term impact
* Curious, open-minded, and adaptable


**What’s in it for you?**
 With us you will be part of the important and meaningful work of developing healthcare for all of us. You have an important mission to make a difference that really matters. In addition, as a company we offer you professional growth, open and friendly culture, and an outstanding work-life balance! We believe that our organizational culture is an important part of enabling you to be successful. We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working.
   

  

 Finally, we also believe in curiosity and learning as a lifestyle. We want to encourage you to keep up that curiosity and deepen your knowledge on topics you’re interested in. For example, we host a ‘Keep Learning Week’ twice a year, a week where everyone at Tietoevry has the possibility to join different training courses in a truly global setting.
   

  

**Could you be our new colleague?**
 We look forward to hearing from you! We will fill the position as soon as we find the right person, so we encourage you to apply today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact the hiring manager Kari-Antti Kuosa (kari-antti.kuosa@tietoevry.com)
   

  

*We perform background checks on all final candidates.*
*Tietoevry declines calls from recruitment companies.*
**About Tietoevry**
 Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.
   

  

 Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprises and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs.
   

  

 Additional Information
   

  

 At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity.
   

  

 Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Operatör
description:
**Job Description**
**Om företaget**
*Sherwin-Williams grundades i USA 1866. År 2010 förvärvades tidigare Becker Acroma som sedan dess ingår i Sherwin-Williamskoncernen. Idag är Sherwin-Williams ett globalt ledande företag inom färgbranschen med egen tillverkning, utveckling och försäljning. Globalt är vi över 63 000 medarbetare varav 330 i Sverige fördelade på fyra orter med tillverkning i Märsta och Bellö, centrallager i Nässjö samt med en helägd återförsäljare i Vaggeryd. I Sverige fokuserar vi på industriell ytbehandling av trä och metall där våra enheter utgör en central roll av vår totala försäljning i Europa.*
**Responsibilities**
**Om rollen**
 Vi söker nu operatörer till vår produktionsfabrik i Bellö. Som operatör kommer du att spela en viktig roll i vårt dagliga arbete genom att aktivt delta i produktionsprocessen och säkerställa att våra höga kvalitetsstandarder bibehålls. De huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifterna består av att tillverka färdiga produkter genom att noggrant följa angivna recept och instruktioner, hantera av maskiner och utrustning, truckkörning, genomförande av kvalitetskontroller samt att följa säkerhetsrutiner och arbetsanvisningar.
   

  

 Även om arbetet kräver självständighet kommer du att vara en del av ett härligt team där samarbete och kommunikation är av högsta prioritet. Det finns också goda utvecklingsmöjligheter inom företaget och vi har många duktiga medarbetare som jobbat länge inom företaget och som haft en imponerande utvecklingsresa.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**Vem är du?**
 Ett krav för att vara aktuell för rollen är att du har truckkort A och B (helst B3), god fysisk förmåga samt att du talar och läser obehindrat på svenska. Du trivs i en industriell arbetsmiljö och förstår vikten av ett aktivt säkerhetstänk och att följa säkerhetsrutiner. Vi ser gärna att du har minst ett års praktisk erfarenhet av industri/produktionsarbete, men vi välkomnar även ansökningar från personer med erfarenhet av liknande branscher som är redo att lära och växa inom området. God datorvana är meriterande.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**
 Hos oss får du chansen till en spännande tjänst i ett stort internationellt företag med många kontaktytor och goda utvecklingsmöjligheter. Genom kollektivavtal, friskvårdsbidrag och andra förmåner är vi en arbetsplats som värdesätter din trygghet och ditt välmående. Observera att du kommer genomgå en nyanställningsundersökning inför anställning vilket bl.a. innefattar alkohol- och drogtest.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**About Us**
 At Sherwin-Williams, our purpose is to inspire and improve the world by coloring and protecting what matters. Our paints, coatings and innovative solutions make the places and spaces in our world brighter and stronger. Your skills, talent and passion make it possible to live this purpose, and for customers and our business to achieve great results. Sherwin-Williams is a place that takes its stability, growth and momentum and translates it to possibility for our people. Our people are behind the strength of our success, and we invest and support you in:
   

  

 Life … with rewards, benefits and the flexibility to enhance your health and well-being
   

  

 Career … with opportunities to learn, develop new skills and grow your contribution
   

  

 Connection … with an inclusive team and commitment to our own and broader communities
   

  

 It's all here for you... let's Create Your
 **Possible**
 Eligibility to Work
   

  

 You will need to provide proof of right to work. It is a condition of any offer of employment we make to you that you have the permission to work in the country for the role for which you are applying for.
   

  

 Equal Opportunity Employer
   

  

 An equal opportunity employer, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against based on race, colour, religion or belief, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, ethnic or national origin, disability, age pregnancy or maternity, marital or civil partner status, or any other protected characteristic prohibited by law.
   

  

 Please be aware, Sherwin-Williams recruiting team members will never request a candidate to provide a payment, ask for financial information, or sensitive personal information like national identification numbers, date of birth, or bank account numbers during the application process.

title: Lead Software Architect - Tietoevry Care (m/f/d)
description:
**Job Description**
**At Tietoevry Care you’ll get a chance to provide patients and end users with product offerings that help them in their life, reinventing the world for good. If that sounds interesting, please keep on reading.**
**About Us**
 Tietoevry Care is modernizing the Nordic health and social care sector with modular, open, and interoperable software. We develop and deliver high quality software solutions and services that enable healthcare and welfare professionals to do their work even better and with higher efficiency - have more time to care.

In addition to working closely with our customers, we also have our own products that we build and develop for various fields in society. With us you can build technology for the good of society and make your mark on the health and wellbeing of people in need.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Are you passionate about leveraging modern technologies to revolutionize healthcare? If so, we invite you to join our dynamic and innovative team as a
 **Lead** 
**Software Architect** 
 ! We're a tech-forward company dedicated to enhancing health and social care through open platforms, ecosystems, and adherence to leading healthcare standards like FHIR and openEHR.
   

  

 We work in an agile, multinational organization that develops cutting-edge products and services for both public and private sectors across the Nordic countries. Our teams are committed to creating, supporting, and delivering modern solutions used by healthcare and social care professionals throughout the region.
   

  

 While we've listed several skills and experiences that we believe would be beneficial for this role, please don't be discouraged if you don't tick every box. We're primarily looking for a Lead Software Architect who is eager to learn and grow with us.
   

  

**With Us You Will Be Responsible For**
* Leading Product Design and Architecture: You will lead architectural decisions that shape the future of our healthcare solutions, ensuring scalability, security, and alignment with industry standards
* Collaborating with Global Teams and Customers: You will understand their needs and translate them into effective technical solutions
* Engaging with Customer Stakeholders: You will build strong relationships to maintain a clear and predictable product vision
* Identifying and Mitigating Risks: You will detect gaps in architecture, security, deployment, and configuration, proposing solutions to minimize risks and enhance system integrity
* Mentoring and Coaching Team Members: You will guide them in resolving complex technical issues and foster a culture of continuous learning and improvement


**We Are Looking For Someone With**
* Extensive Experience in Software Development and Architecture, with a proven track record in designing and implementing complex software systems
* Knowledge of Cloud and Containerization, including proficiency in public and private cloud platforms and container technologies like Docker and Kubernetes
* Expertise in Healthcare Standards like FHIR, openEHR, and SMART on FHIR to ensure interoperability and compliance
* Visionary Architectural Skills to conceptualize and design holistic solution architectures that meet current and future needs
* Agile Methodology Proficiency, with experience working in agile environments utilizing methodologies like Scrum or Kanban
* Strong Technical Skills in microservices architecture, RESTful APIs, web development, and design patterns
* Programming Expertise, with excellent coding skills in languages such as C# and experience with frontend frameworks like Angular
* DevSecOps Experience, with exposure to integrating security practices into the DevOps process to ensure secure and reliable software delivery


**As a Person You Are**
* Solution-Oriented, always focused on finding effective resolutions
* Self-Motivated & Self-Organized, with the ability to manage your own tasks efficiently
* Independent and Responsible, capable of taking ownership of your work
* A Good Team Player, with attention to detail and the ability to collaborate well with others


**What’s in it for you?**
 With us you will be part of the important and meaningful work of developing healthcare for all of us. You have an important mission to make a difference that really matters. In addition, as a company we offer you professional growth, open and friendly culture, and an outstanding work-life balance! We believe that our organizational culture is an important part of enabling you to be successful. We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working.
   

  

 Finally, we also believe in curiosity and learning as a lifestyle. We want to encourage you to keep up that curiosity and deepen your knowledge on topics you’re interested in. For example, we host a ‘Keep Learning Week’ twice a year, a week where everyone at Tietoevry has the possibility to join different training courses in a truly global setting.

title: Legal Counsel
description:
*Adapteo is the leading adaptable space partner in Northern Europe.* 
*Adapteo offers flexible, moveable, modular solutions for interim to long-term needs in social infrastructure through its Space-as-a-Service (SpaaS) model to a wide, primarily public customer base including municipalities, educational institutions, healthcare providers and large and long-term infrastructure projects for energy transition, mobility and digitalisation.* 
*With our modular and circular building solutions, our customers can transform, repurpose, scale up or scale down based on their changing needs. That is how we build adaptable and sustainable societies (see our circular film* 
*here* 
*).* 
*The business primarily operates a rental model, with 95% of gross profit generated through primarily mid- to long-term fixed fee rental contracts, complemented by sales activities comprising 5% of the gross profit. Adapteo has a portfolio of 1.6 million square metres, operates across nine markets, also referred to as business units, and employs around 650 people in Sweden, Finland, Denmark, Norway, Germany, the Netherlands, Belgium, Lithuania and Estonia. Adapteo’s headquarters are in Vantaa, Finland and Solna, Sweden*
 We are now looking for a Group Legal Counsel to join our General Counsel at our Group office. This role will be based in Solna, Sweden.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 The Group Legal Counsel will provide broad legal and compliance support across the Adapteo Group, working closely with Group functions and business units to ensure compliance with applicable laws and alignment with best-practice corporate governance standards.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Advise on commercial agreements, procurement, customer contracts, and real estate matters.
* Deliver legal risk assessments and propose mitigation strategies to support business decision-making.
* Assist in implementing and maintaining compliance programs, including the Code of Conduct, Anti-Bribery and Corruption, AML, and Data Privacy policies.
* Monitor and analyze regulatory developments relevant to our industry.
* Coordinate with external counsel on litigation, transactions, and specialist matters.
* Contribute to corporate governance initiatives, policy development, and legal training across the Group.


**Who You Are**
* LL.M. or equivalent legal degree.
* 2–4 years' post-qualification experience in a reputable law firm or in-house legal department.
* Solid understanding of Nordic and EU legal and regulatory frameworks.
* Strong drafting and negotiation skills, with experience in commercial, regulatory, and corporate law.
* Demonstrated ability to work independently, handle multiple priorities, and communicate effectively.
* Experience in construction, infrastructure, and/or public procurement law is a distinct advantage.


**Why join Adapteo?**
 We’re redefining what it means to build for a more sustainable, adaptable, and inclusive society. Our modular spaces support schools, elderly care homes, worker housing, and crisis response — and they can be moved, reused, and repurposed again and again.
   

  

 You’ll join a friendly, fast-paced, and collaborative team that works across markets and functions. We keep things pragmatic but ambitious, with room to shape ideas and drive meaningful impact.
   

  

**Application**
 In this recruitment process, Adapteo is supported by Law Recruitment. Interviews will be carried out as applications are received. Please apply via www.lawrecruitment.se. Note that we do not accept applications by email. If you have any questions, please contact recruitment consultant Helena Woodcock by phone at 070-260 36 96, or via email at helena.woodcock@lawrecruitment.se
   

  

 We are looking forward to your application!

title: Erfaren Scrum Master till två lean agila team
description:
Om företaget
  
Avaron AB är ett entreprenörsdrivet konsultbolag som stöttar kunder inom IT, finans och industri med kvalificerade kompetenser. Hos oss får du arbeta nära besluten, med korta vägar från idé till leverans, och möjlighet att påverka både uppdrag och arbetssätt.
  
Arbetsuppgifter
  
Som konsult från Avaron AB kliver du in som Scrum Master i två lean-agila team hos en av våra kunder. Ditt fokus är att skapa ett jämnt flöde av värde genom att coacha, inspirera och utbilda team och intressenter i lean-agila principer och praktiker. Du stödjer självorganisering, undanröjer hinder, främjar transparens och hjälper teamen att hålla kurs mot uppsatta mål. I nära samarbete med Product Owner balanserar du tekniska förbättringar med verksamhetens behov och utvecklar samarbetet med angränsande team och funktioner. Arbetet sker enligt kundens policy delvis på plats, cirka halva arbetstiden.
  
Kvalifikationer (Ska-krav)
  
Flerårig erfarenhet av arbete inom IT-utveckling
  
Djup erfarenhet av agila arbetssätt såsom Scrum och Kanban samt mycket god teknisk förståelse
  
Relevant akademisk utbildning
  
Mycket god förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på både svenska och engelska
  
Stark samarbetsförmåga och kommunikativ förmåga med intressenter i och utanför teamet
  
Trygg i att hantera konflikter och att verka i en föränderlig, tempofylld miljö med utvecklingsfokus
  
Senior kompetens motsvarande nivå 4 med hög självständighet och vana att leda större grupper
  
Möjlighet att genomgå och godkännas i bakgrundskontroll enligt kundens krav
  
  

Meriterande (Bra att ha)
  
Erfarenhet av att arbeta i lean-agila team inom SAFe
  
Praktisk vana av Azure DevOps som agilt planerings- och uppföljningsverktyg
  
Branscherfarenhet från bank eller försäkring
  
  

Ansökan
  
Våra tjänster kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag, då vi hanterar ansökningarna löpande. Vi rekommenderar dig därför att söka så snart som möjligt.
  
Mejla CV till jobb@avaron.se. Märk mejlet med "Erfaren Scrum Master till två lean agila team (13016)".

title: Senior Teknisk Testare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.

 **Din profil (Skall krav)**

  

* Minst 4 år i aktuell roll
* Du ska ha minst 3 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av att självständigt etablera och arbeta med ramverk för testautomatisering i agila utvecklingsteam.
* Du ska ha minst 3 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av att skapa automatiserade GUI-, regressionstester och flödestester (del- och helflöden) i komplexa användarscenarier med Playwright.
* Du ska ha minst 3 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av att skriva och underhålla API-tester, inklusive autentisering och hantering av headers.
* Du ska ha minst 3 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av att arbeta med versionshantering i Git och/eller Bitbucket.

  

  

**Meriterande**  

* PEGA-plattformen: Som DevOps-stöd (tCI/CD, Pega samt arbete med testautomatisering i PEGA-baserade applikationer, prestandatestning and API-testing i PEGA-applikationer gärna inom offentlig sektor eller större organisationer
* Du har arbetat med teststrategier för automatisering i plattformsbaserade lösningar (lowcode/no-code) Erfarenhet av att dokumentera fram teststrategier för automatisering, inklusive val av verktyg och ramverk, anpassade till teamets sprintplanering och arbetssätt
* Du har arbetat med test som en integrerad del av teamets leveransansvar, inklusive coachning i testautomatisering på PEGA-plattformen och formulering av testbara acceptanskriterier i planeringsstadiet

  

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 04-09-2025 **Om Deploja**  

  

Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.  

  

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?

  

Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?

 *Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.*

title: DevOps-tekniker
description:
Vi söker dig som har spetskompetens inom DevOps och vill ta nästa kliv i karriären, på en arbetsplats som uppmuntrar nyfikenhet, driv och utveckling.

**Arbetsuppgifter:**


Du kommer arbeta med kodutveckling i objektorienterat programmeringsspråk, samt automatisering av molnbaserade teknologier inklusive distribution av applikationer och provisionering av infrastruktur. Vi ser gärna att du har praktisk erfarenhet av Infrastructure as Code, med användning av verktyg som AWS CDK, Cloudformation eller liknande, och hands on erfarenhet av mikrotjänster och distribuerad applikationsarkitektur, exempelvis användning av containrar, Kubernetes och/eller serverlös teknologi.

**Kompetenskrav:**


– Erfarenhet av en eller flera molnplattformar såsom AWS, Azure, Google, OpenStack  

– Erfarenhet av Kubernetes (OpenShift, AKS, EKS)  

– Linux  

– Automatisering t.ex. Ansible  

– Erfarenhet av programmering/script (Java, JavaScript, Python, Bach, Perl t.ex.)  

– CI/CD  

– Git  

– Säkerhet

  



**Humanit**


Humanit handlar om att göra saker lite annorlunda, att på riktigt sätta våra anställda i fokus. Vi växer tillsammans och värdesätter engagemang och ambition. För oss är det viktigt att du får chansen att vara med och påverka vägen framåt.


I utbyte erbjuder vi kompetens- och karriärutveckling genom varierande och utmanande uppdrag. Vi är inte branschinriktade och kan därför erbjuda en fantastisk variation bland uppdragen för dig som konsult. Självklart ser vi till att du får rätt utbildning och vi är väl medvetna om att det är det livslånga lärandet som bygger vår framgång.


Tillsammans skapar vi framtiden  

  



* Tillsvidareanställning med fast månadslön
* Kollektivavtal
* Vi tillämpar sex månaders provanställning, inklusive maxat friskvårdsbidrag
* Utvecklingsplan
* Hälsoförsäkring + pension
* Förskottssemester
  

**Start**: Omgående med hänsyn till uppsägningstid och när säkerhetskontroll är genomförd. Uppdraget är på heltid och är tillsvidare.

**Plats**: Stockholm

**Ansökan**: Vi rekryterar löpande. Så skicka in din ansökan redan idag!

*Humanit arbetar tillsammans med Great Place To Work för att vi skall bli Sveriges bästa arbetsplats.*

 **Och förresten:**

*Som en aktiv del i ett samhälle med kulturell och social mångfald är Humanit’s ambition att präglas av inkludering och bred representation, samt vara en arbetsplats med lika möjligheter för alla. Humanit anställer, bibehåller, befordrar och i övrigt behandlar alla medarbetare och kandidater efter erfarenhet, kvalifikationer och kompetens, oavsett kön, religion, ursprung, ålder, sexuell läggning, könsidentitet eller funktionsvariationer.*

title: Senior Node.js/Typescript
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.

* Etablering av kodstandarder och konventioner
* Tech-lead ansvar i tvärfunktionella team

* God kommunikationsförmåga och vana att påverka tvärfunktionella team

title: Förvaltningsledare
description:
**Förvaltningsledare**
----------------------

**Din roll**

Sogeti Västerås och Eskilstuna har ett stort team som jobbar inhouse med projekt och förvaltning. Våra fokusområden är Microsoft365-lösningar och alltmer fokus inom Data och AI där vi är starka. Nu söker vi en ny förvaltningsledare till teamet. Det här en central roll hos oss och viktigast av allt, ett väldigt utvecklande och roligt jobb!  

  



I denna roll kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i:


* Teamet! Vi levererar som ett team och det är viktigt att se personers styrkor och utvecklingsområden
* Kundrelationer! Våra kunder uppskattar vårt arbete och vårt engangemang. Som förvaltningsledare är du många gånger kundens huvudsakliga kontaktyta med Sogeti.
* Leveranser! Att leverera kvalitet på tid och inom budget är en ledstjärna för oss. Att guida teamet igenom projekt och uppdrag är en viktig del av ditt arbete

**Din profil**

* Du behöver ha minst några års erfarenhet som förvaltningsledare inom IT och systemutveckling
* Du pratar och skriver svenska flytande
* Du bor i eller i närheten av Västerås eller Eskilstuna
Det är stor en fördel om du är intresserad av teknik och vad den kan göra för att förbättra för våra kunder  
* 
**Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas:**

* Innovativ miljö: Hos oss får du chansen att jobba med den senaste tekniken och vara en del av ett dynamiskt team som älskar att skapa värde genom innovation.
* Karriärutveckling: Vi bryr oss om din framtid och erbjuder utvecklingsprogram och certifieringar i de senaste teknologierna, så att du kan växa och bli den bästa versionen av dig själv.
* Flexibelt arbete: Vi förstår att livet är mer än bara jobb. Därför erbjuder vi möjligheter till distansarbete och flexibla arbetstider för att du ska må bra och trivas.
* Teamkänsla: Vi har en härlig teamkänsla. Genom att leva efter våra värdeord som mod, passion, laganda och entreprenörskap skapar vi en arbetsmiljö där alla kan trivas.

**Intresseanmälan**  

  

Genväg för snabb kontakt innan du ansöker? Självklart! Vi är bara två klick och ett micro-formulär bort. Första **klicket här** och du är halvvägs klar.  



**Ansökan**

Urval sker löpande, så vänta inte med din ansökan. Varmt välkommen!  



**Om Oss**

Sogeti Sverige, en del av Capgemini-koncernen, med 21 kontor och 1300 medarbetare, skapar affärsvärde med teknologi för organisationer som behöver införa innovation snabbt och som vill ha en lokal partner med global skalbarhet. Med en hands-on-kultur och närhet till kunderna, implementerar Sogeti lösningar som hjälper organisationer att arbeta snabbare, bättre och smartare. Genom att kombinera agilitet och snabb implementation via en DevOps-ansats, levererar Sogeti innovativa lösningar inom test- och kvalitetssäkring, molnet och systemutveckling, förstärkta av AI, data och automation.
  

  

Kontakta gärna rekryterande chef Jan Stenwall, jan.stenwall@sogeti.se , som kan svara på frågor om tjänsten.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Here at Billogram, we believe that treating people well always pays off. We like to be the good guys of billing, making money when clients are happy and pay on time, rather than from missed payments. That’s why our platform for invoices and payments is built to remove pain points and be beneficial to both our clients and their customers, improving their relationships. We're looking for a talented Infrastructure Engineer to join our team and help us shape the future of billing!

**About the Role**


We’re looking for an Infrastructure Engineer who enjoys keeping things running smoothly and supporting our growing product. If you enjoy working with a team to solve practical challenges, enabling developers with better tools, you’ll fit right in. We want someone humble, pragmatic, and eager to learn: excited to fit into the team, take part in discussions, and explore new technologies together. You’ll join colleagues who value cooperation to ensure our platform stays stable and secure.


This is a hybrid position, and you can be based at either our Stockholm or Bucharest office. A valid visa or work permit is required, with no relocation assistance offered.

**What You’ll Do**

* **Develop and maintain infrastructure:** Ensure the underlying infrastructure is up and running and supports the product optimally as we grow with more customers.
* **Support Developers:** Enable teams to build and deploy services efficiently and securely, including optimizing CI/CD pipelines.
* **Secure the Platform:** Keep the platform secure, monitor systems, and assist in resolving incidents to maintain stability.
* **Optimize Processes:** Enhance testing and deployment workflows to improve the development experience and remove silos.
* **Collaborate:** Work with engineering teams, share knowledge, and contribute to strategies that benefit everyone.
* 

**Key Qualifications**

* Three or more years working with cloud infrastructure, preferably AWS.
* Knowledge of Kubernetes
* A security-minded approach to all tasks, emphasizing technical safety.
* Pragmatic mindset for solving issues, delivering results, and participating in team discussions.
* 

**Bonus Skills**

* Working knowledge of databases
* Experience with building, monitoring, and alerting on logs and metrics
* Knowledge of a technical scripting language, preferably Python or Bash.
* Experience building and maintaining CI/CD pipelines.
* Hands-on experience in Terraform or Terragrunt.
* 

**Why Work with Us?**


At Billogram, we promise you an exciting journey as we break into new markets and grow at a rapid pace. Beyond that, you will get lots of freedom and opportunity to develop together with great colleagues at our office, right in the center of Stockholm. We also offer flexible working hours, exciting challenges, and a supportive and fun work environment.


We're committed to your long-term development, offering clear career progression paths. You'll also enjoy a fantastic benefits package, including 30 (+2) days of holiday, an occupational pension, a flexible wellness allowance, sick leave top-up, and parental leave compensation. At Billogram, our inclusive and diverse culture ensures that everyone can enjoy a fulfilling career and a great work-life balance.


This recruitment process is managed internally, and we respectfully request no contact from recruitment agencies.


At Billogram, we provide equal opportunities and strive for an inclusive and diverse environment. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to gender, transgender identity or expression, ethnicity, religion or other beliefs, disability, sexual orientation, or age.


Welcome to the world of Billogram!

title: Tech Lead (.NET) - BESS Cloud Platform
description:
**Seeking a Tech Lead to shape the future of smart energy**
-----------------------------------------------------------


The European energy system is in the midst of a green transition, where battery energy storage systems will play a central role, and we need you to make it happen!


Capture Energy, a fast-growing Swedish company founded in 2023 and with 38 employees currently, aims to become a market leader in the Nordics in providing battery energy storage systems (BESS) for energy flexibility services - a market that is expected to experience significant growth in the coming years. With innovation at our core, we're building the digital infrastructure that powers the clean energy transition - starting with our next-generation platform, Capture Cloud.


As a small company today, we are able to operate very differently compared to the larger players on the market, which gives us a great competitive position. We are committed to bringing good energy to every setting where we operate: from our customers, partners, to our employees.

### **About The Role**


We are seeking a **hands-on Tech Lead** to join our team in Stockholm and drive the **development of our cloud platform** supporting battery energy storage solutions (BESS). The platform combines scalable backend services with modern web applications, enabling reliable and secure energy management. This role blends deep **.NET development utilizing Azure cloud services** with **technical leadership, architecture design**, and close collaboration with product stakeholders. You will mentor engineers, shape the product vision from a technical perspective, and ensure security, scalability, and quality in everything we deliver.

### **Key Responsibilities**

* **Lead, mentor, and coach** a team of software engineers, fostering best practices and high-quality deliverables.
* **Collaborate with Product Manager, Product Designer, and stakeholders** to align technical solutions with product vision and business goals.
* Define and oversee **solution design, architecture, and technical implementations** for both backend services and web applications.
* Conduct **code reviews** and provide guidance on architecture, scalability, performance, and cybersecurity.
* Contribute to **feature discovery** by providing technical insights and developing Proof of Concepts (PoCs) where needed.
* Drive the team towards a **continuous delivery setup** with DevOps and CI/CD practices.
* Oversee **software release management** and contribute to product documentation.
* Stay up to date with **emerging technologies** and recommend improvements to tools, processes, and system architecture.
* Balance **hands-on coding** with leadership responsibilities to ensure timely and efficient delivery.

### 

### **Skills and Qualifications**

* **9+ years of software development experience**, including at least 2 years in a leadership or team lead role.
* Strong, hands-on experience with **.NET / C#**, building and maintaining scalable backend services and REST APIs.
* Practical experience working with **cloud platforms (preferably Azure)** and event-driven architectures.
* Strong understanding of **software architecture, cloud-native design, and cybersecurity best practices**.
* Experience with **relational databases** such as PostgreSQL.
* Experience with **time-series databases** and **big data analysis** in large-scale environments.
* Understanding of how to apply **AI and machine learning** techniques in data-intensive platforms (e.g., forecasting, anomaly detection, optimization).
* Good understanding of **infrastructure as code** concepts (e.g., Terraform) and ability to collaborate with DevOps engineers.
* Experience with **identity and access management solutions**.
* Familiarity with **modern frontend frameworks** is a plus.
* Good experience in **planning integrations** with external systems.
* Experience in **IoT environments**, with knowledge of protocols such as **MQTT** or **Modbus**, is a plus.
* Excellent communication and leadership skills in an Agile environment, with the ability to mentor and inspire team members.
* Fluency in English.

### 

### **Why Join Us?**


As a part of our team, you will have the opportunity to work in an environment that encourages personal and professional growth. We are committed to supporting our employees, offering opportunities for training and progression to those who show dedication and enthusiasm in their roles. Our team is our most valuable asset, and we strive to ensure each member feels valued, supported, and inspired.

### **We offer**

* An opportunity to shape both the technical direction and product vision of a platform at the core of renewable energy storage solutions
* An inspiring workplace where people are at the heart of everything we do, driving us toward our vision
* Hands-on work with modern technologies in a cloud-native, IoT-driven environment
* Competitive salary
* Maximized wellness contribution
* Pension and health insurance

### **Application Process**


If you believe you have the responsibility, independence, and drive we are looking for, please submit your CV and a covering letter detailing your suitability for the role. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace.


We look forward to hearing from you and possibly welcoming you to our team.

### **About the company**


Capture Energy, established in 2023, aims to be a major player in large-scale battery energy storage systems for flexibility services. We distinguish ourselves by providing turnkey solutions with smart services.


Visit our website for more information: www.captureenergy.eu

title: Senior Azure Consultant på Advania
description:
**Senior Azure Consultant på Advania️**
---------------------------------------


Vill du arbeta nära både tekniken och kunden – och samtidigt bidra till smarta, hållbara lösningar i molnet? Som Senior Azure Consultant på Advania är du med och bygger samt vidareutvecklar våra kunders Azure-miljöer. Du blir en viktig del av vårt engagerade team inom affärsområdet Managed Services Provider – där vi kombinerar drift och förvaltning med transformation, automatisering och nyetablering i Microsoft Azure.  

  

**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter;**

* Bygga, förvalta och vidareutveckla lösningar i Microsoft Azure
* Automatisera och effektivisera infrastruktur med verktyg som PowerShell, Bicep och Azure DevOps
* Delta i kundleveranser, från projekt och incidenthantering till workshops och löpande leverans
* Bidra till arkitekturval, teknikutveckling och förbättringsarbete
* Arbeta nära kund och säkerställa att våra lösningar skapar långsiktigt värde


Rollen är varierad och flexibel – vissa uppdrag innebär att du arbetar ute hos kund flera dagar i veckan, andra gånger är du baserad från kontoret eller på distans. Oavsett vilket har du alltid ditt team i ryggen.

**Vad vi söker hos dig**
------------------------

Du har ett par års erfarenhet av att arbeta med Azure på ett självständigt sätt, gärna i kundnära sammanhang. Det viktigaste är inte antal år utan att du trivs med att ta ansvar, driva frågor och bidra med din kunskap.  

  

Du har ett genuint teknikintresse, trivs i en konsultnära roll och känner dig trygg i att arbeta både självständigt och tillsammans med andra. Du gillar att lösa problem, är nyfiken på nya verktyg och ser värdet av att bygga långsiktiga relationer, både med kund och kollegor.


**Vi söker dig som har:**

* Några års självständig erfarenhet av arbete med infrastruktur i **Microsoft Azure**
* God kunskap i **PowerShell** och gärna även i **Bicep och Azure DevOps**
* Vana att arbeta med **Infrastructure as Code** och **molnautomation**
* Erfarenhet från **IT-drift** eller **systemadministration**
* **Konsultmässighet** – du trivs i dialogen med kund och bygger förtroende i leveranser
* Goda kunskaper i **svenska** och **engelska**, både i tal och skrift
  

**Meriterande:**

* Certifieringar inom Azure eller närliggande områden
* 

Här på Advania får du vara med och skapa hållbara värden genom smart användning av teknik. Vi är ett personligt företag där du får frihet under ansvar, utvecklingsmöjligheter och stöttning från ett kompetent team. Vi tror på kraften i att ge varje individ möjlighet att växa, påverka – och göra skillnad.

  


### **Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!**

Visa gärna ditt intresse så snart som möjligt då vi intervjuar löpande. Vi välkomnar sökanden med olika bakgrunder, erfarenheter och synsätt, eftersom vi vet att en bredare mångfald berikar var och en av oss och stärker såväl effektivitet som kreativitet i vårt arbete.


Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår våra slutkandidater en obligatorisk bakgrundskontroll, och det förekommer personlighet-och logiktest, vilket bidrar till kvalitativ kontroll inför ett anställningsbeslut. Advania samarbetar även med Ljung & Sjöberg för en proaktiv arbetsplats kopplat till alkohol och droger.


Tveka inte att höra av dig om du har några frågor eller funderingar.
company_description: Advania är ett techbolag som utformar skräddarsydda lösningar och skapar hållbara värden genom smart användning av teknik.

title: Lead Infrastructure Engineer Within Digital Site Services
description:
*Studies show that women and underrepresented groups often hesitate to apply unless they meet every requirement. At* Stegra, we’re building an impact-driven, sustainable company - and we need a diverse, inclusive team to make it happen.


*If you share our passion but* don’t meet every qualification, we encourage you to apply anyway. You might be the perfect fit for this role, or another as we grow.


At Stegra, we’re not just building a plant, we’re proving that sustainable industry is possible. And to do that, we need people like you.


Join a team where safety comes first. Where we support each other, learn as we go, and make space for everyone to grow and contribute. This is your chance to be part of something big - while being closer to nature and leading a balanced, purposeful life.


**What you’ll do**

Right now, we are looking for a Lead Infrastructure Engineer for our Digital Site Services. In this role you will report to our Digital Domain Manager and sit within our Digital function. The team is responsible for deliver secure, resilient, and innovative infrastructure solutions, including fully redundant datacenters. As our Lead Infrastructure Engineer, you’ll play a vital role in designing and maintaining the systems that power our Digital Factory. Based in Boden and part of Strega’s dynamic digital team, you’ll ensure our platforms drive productivity, safety, and sustainability.


Specific to this role, the day-to-day tasks will include the following but as we are a growing company with very little silos between teams, other tasks might be included as well.  

  



* Oversee the deployment, commissioning, and configuration of digital infrastructure, including both hardware and software.
* Configure and operate physical servers, storage, backup systems, datacenter support functions, as well as virtualization environments (both on-premises and in the cloud).
* Work closely with team members and vendors to design digital infrastructure and implement best practices.
* Define operational processes for monitoring and maintaining infrastructure, ensuring secure, efficient, and reliable operations.
* Develop plans for maintenance and support to minimize downtime and ensure smooth operations.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs, prioritize infrastructure requirements, and ensure the safe and robust platform while improving productivity, safety, and sustainability in the factory.
* Create and document best practices, and mentor team members to foster growth and improve infrastructure operations.
* Participate in an on-call rotation together with other team members to support the 24/7 operation of critical infrastructure.

  

**What you’ll bring**

We’re seeking someone with a proactive and collaborative mindset who thrives in a dynamic environment. You excel at problem-solving, organization, and clear communication, especially when explaining technical solutions to non-technical stakeholders. Empathy for end-users and a passion for creating technology that improves their daily work are key traits we value.


Specific to this role, we would like to see that you can tick off a fair amount of the boxes below

* A University degree or equivalent experience, Bachelor or Master’s in Engineering or Computer Science.
* Expertise with administration of Linux and Windows based systems.
* Relevant experience in datacenter operations.
* Hands-on experience with configuring and managing virtualization environments such as VMware / Nutanix.
* Hands-on experience in Infrastructure provisioning and configuration management via infrastructure as code (IaC) – Ansible / Terraform.
* Hands-on experience with Kubernetes for Containers management, deployment and scaling.
* Knowledge of Cybersecurity best practices, and experience in analyzing possible threats and vulnerabilities, embedding security standards, monitoring adherence to them, and implementing disaster recovery plans.
* Experience with Active Directory and Users management systems.
* Very good experience with AWS services configuration and management.
* Experience with performance monitoring and troubleshooting for hosts, servers, databases, virtual machines, containers.
* Good knowledge of networks and network protocols.
* Experience with Data Backup solutions.
* Experience in writing scripts with at least one scripting language — such as Python, Java, JavaScript, etc.
* Experience with OT infrastructure such as Historians, HMI, Scada, Edge gateways.
* Experience with Agile and DevOps methodologies, and with Continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) platforms.

**Location:** Boden, Sweden

 **Benefits at Stegra**  

  

At Stegra, you’ll join a company where your work has real impact on the climate, the industry, and future generations. We’re building a culture rooted in safety, trust, and inclusion, where people feel supported to grow and thrive.


You’ll receive fair, competitive compensation aligned with collective agreements, along with benefits like up to 30 days of paid vacation, occupational pension, parental benefits, and insurance. If you need support with relocation or immigration, our relocation department will help guide you through the process, whether it’s permits, housing or other practical matters. You can also enjoy perks like subsidized gym memberships and bike leases, plus the everyday benefits of life closer to nature.


Read more about Benefits at Stegra here.


**This is Stegra**

Stegra is on a mission to change the global steel industry by producing green hydrogen, iron, and steel - with the goal of eliminating CO₂ emissions. Instead of coal, we use green hydrogen and fossil-free electricity, meaning our primary emissions will be water and heat.


By 2030, our ambition is to produce 5 million tonnes of green steel annually in our fully integrated, digitized, and sustainable plant in Boden, Northern Sweden - currently under construction. But this is just the beginning. Our expertise in green hydrogen will enable us to decarbonize industries beyond steel, paving the way for a cleaner future.


**Our Boden Site**


Our Boden site is located just west of Boden City, right in the heart of a growing green industrial hub in Northern Sweden. It’s where we’re building one of the world’s most modern, sustainable steel plants—designed with safety, efficiency, and people in mind. With just a 10-minute commute from town, you'll be close to both cutting-edge technology and the everyday convenience of living near nature, schools, and community life.


Boden Video

title: Site Reliability Engineer
description:
**Description & Requirements**
 Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.
   

  

 Electronic Arts Information Technology (EAIT) group keeps our employees and business operations connected globally. As a digital entertainment company, EA’s enterprise technology needs are diverse and span across game development, workforce collaboration, marketing, publishing, player experience, security, and corporate activities. We bring creative technology services to each one of these areas, keeping everyone creative, collaborative and productive. Our team ensures better play across all of EA and needs your help to do that.
   

  

 We are the IT team supporting AAA game development in a highly collaborative environment at our DICE studio in central Stockholm. Join us in powering the future of play alongside the teams behind Battlefield, Frostbite and many more.
   

  

 We are looking for a Site Reliability Engineer to join our Site IT Infrastructure team.
   

  

 As a Site Reliability Engineer, you will be responsible for managing and supporting the IT infrastructure, ensuring the reliability and efficiency of compute, storage, and network systems. This role is a full-time, hybrid position based in Stockholm, with both remote and onsite work, where you will be reporting to the Senior Site IT Manager.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Implementation and administration of data center hardware.
* Overseeing, managing, and optimizing virtualization platforms.
* Monitor and maintain the datacenter environment.
* Managing enterprise networking and basic troubleshooting.
* Respond to and resolve service outages and alert events efficiently to support business operations.
* Be part of a rotating on-call schedule for infrastructure support.
* Provide technical support to employees on both hardware and software issues.
* Procurement of infrastructure hardware, management of service agreements, and tracking of asset inventory.
* Work closely with global teams to deliver consistent IT services to our users.
* Maintain relationships with the business, vendors, and other functions.
* Ensure documentation is thoroughly maintained and regularly updated.
* Managing and allocating budgets for IT resources and projects.


**Requirements**
* 5+ years of infrastructure experience in the IT industry.
* Extensive experience with servers, storage systems, and virtualization.
* Knowledge of Windows Server and Linux operating systems.
* Basic understanding of networking and network administration.
* Experience with containers, scripting and automation tools is a plus but not required.
* Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.
* Ability to prioritize, coordinate, and organize tasks effectively.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Experience with project and budget management.
* Strong documentation skills, including the ability to create guides and articles.


**About Electronic Arts**
 We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.
   

  

 We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.
   

  

 Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

title: Senior Solutions Architect
description:
**Description**
 Revolutionize Public Services Through Cloud Technology: Transform How Public Sector Organizations Innovate and Serve Citizens
   

  

 We're seeking an exceptional technologist passionate about driving digital transformation across public sector organizations. In this role, you'll be a strategic technology partner, helping diverse institutions leverage cutting-edge cloud solutions to create meaningful impact.
   

  

 Our Public Sector team is a diverse collective of innovative technologists committed to empowering organizations through cloud technology. We're not just implementing solutions; we're helping reshape how public institutions serve their communities. Our approach combines deep technical expertise with genuine curiosity about our customers' unique challenges.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* Design and recommend comprehensive cloud architectures tailored to specific public sector needs
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop strategic technology roadmaps
* Provide prescriptive guidance on security, cost optimization, performance, and operational efficiency
* Educate customers about cloud capabilities and potential transformative technologies
* Build and maintain strong technical relationships with key public sector stakeholders


 A day in the life
   

  

 Your day will be a dynamic blend of technical exploration and collaborative problem-solving. You'll engage with government agencies, educational institutions, and non-profit organizations, translating complex technological challenges into elegant, scalable cloud solutions. Each interaction is an opportunity to reimagine how technology can enhance public service delivery.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Strong technical background in application architecture and software development
* Experience with IT infrastructure, networking, and security implementations
* Excellent communication skills for articulating complex technical concepts
* Fluency in Swedish language


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Knowledge of modern software development practices like agile methodologies and DevOps
* Experience guiding cloud application adoption and best practices
* Understanding of government certification and compliance frameworks
* Background in technology implementations for government or defense sectors


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
